FV = PV(1 + I/Y)N
where:
PV = amount of money invested today (the present value)
I/Y = rate of return per compounding period
N = total number of compounding periods
In this expression, the investment involves a single cash outflow, PV, which occurs
today, at t = 0 on the time line. The single sum FV formula will determine the value
of an investment at the end of N compounding periods, given that it can earn a fully
compounded rate of return, I/Y, over all of the periods.
